statements: SELECT * FROM demand_trends
SELECT date, demand_amount FROM demand_trends WHERE date > '2022-01-01'
SELECT * FROM demand_trends WHERE demand_trend = 'Increasing' ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT AVG(demand_amount) AS avg_demand FROM demand_trends WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31'
SELECT date, moving_average FROM demand_trends WHERE demand_trend = 'Stable' ORDER BY moving_average DESC
SELECT * FROM demand_trends WHERE demand_amount > 100 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT date, demand_trend FROM demand_trends WHERE moving_average BETWEEN 50 AND 100;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM demand_trends WHERE demand_amount < 50 GROUP BY demand_trend;
SELECT * FROM demand_trends WHERE demand_amount >= 150 OR moving_average < 75 ORDER BY moving_average ASC, date DESC;
SELECT AVG(demand_amount) AS avg_demand, MAX(demand_amount) AS max_demand FROM demand_trends WHERE date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT * FROM table1 ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT date, demand FROM table1 WHERE demand > 100;
SELECT id, date, moving_avg FROM table2 WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-28' ORDER BY date ASC;
SELECT * FROM table1 JOIN table2 ON table1.id = table2.id;
SELECT id, demand_trend FROM table2 WHERE moving_avg > 50 ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT * FROM table1 WHERE demand > 100 ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, date, demand FROM table1 WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' ORDER BY demand ASC;
SELECT id, date, demand FROM table1 WHERE demand < 50 AND date >= '2022-06-01';
SELECT t1.id, t2.date, t1.demand FROM table1 t1 JOIN table2 t2 ON t1.id = t2.id WHERE t2.moving_avg > 25 ORDER BY t1.date ASC, t2.date DESC;
SELECT t1.id, t2.date, t2.demand_trend FROM table1 t1 INNER JOIN table2 t2 ON t1.id = t2.id WHERE t1.date = '2022-07-15';
SELECT * FROM moving_averages;
SELECT id, demand, date FROM demand_trends WHERE demand > 100;
SELECT product_name, year FROM demand_trends WHERE year = 2021;
SELECT id, period_name, start_date, end_date FROM time_periods ORDER BY start_date DESC;
SELECT id, product_name, demand FROM demand_trends WHERE product_name LIKE 'P%' ORDER BY demand DESC;
SELECT * FROM moving_averages WHERE demand > 100 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT id, product_name, year FROM demand_trends WHERE year = 2021 ORDER BY product_name ASC;
SELECT id, demand, date FROM moving_averages WHERE date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31';
SELECT product_name, year, demand FROM demand_trends WHERE year IN (2020, 2021) ORDER BY year DESC, demand DESC;
SELECT * FROM time_periods WHERE start_date <= '2021-06-30' AND end_date >= '2021-06-30';
SELECT * FROM demand_data ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT product_id, SUM(demand) AS total_demand FROM demand_data GROUP BY product_id ORDER BY total_demand DESC;
SELECT date, product_id, demand FROM demand_data WHERE product_id = 101 ORDER BY date ASC;
SELECT date, AVG(moving_avg_demand) AS avg_demand FROM moving_avg_results GROUP BY date ORDER BY avg_demand DESC;
SELECT product_id, demand_trend FROM trend_analysis_results WHERE demand_trend = 'Increasing' OR demand_trend = 'Decreasing';
SELECT * FROM demand_data ORDER BY date DESC, demand DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT product_id, AVG(demand) AS avg_demand FROM demand_data GROUP BY product_id HAVING avg_demand > 50;
SELECT date, product_id, moving_avg_demand FROM moving_avg_results WHERE moving_avg_demand BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY date ASC LIMIT 5;

SELECT trend_analysis_results.product_id, demand_trend FROM trend_analysis_results JOIN demand_data ON trend_analysis_results.product_id = demand_data.product_id WHERE demand > 100 ORDER BY product_id ASC, date DESC;
SELECT * FROM time_periods WHERE start_date < '2023-01-01' AND end_date > '2023-12-31';
SELECT * FROM moving_averages ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT id, date, demand FROM trend_analysis WHERE demand > 100;
SELECT moving_average FROM moving_averages WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT AVG(demand) AS average_demand FROM demand_history;
SELECT * FROM sales_data ORDER BY demand DESC, date ASC;
SELECT * FROM moving_averages ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT SUM(demand) AS total_demand FROM trend_analysis WHERE demand_trend='up'
SELECT moving_average, AVG(demand) AS avg_demand FROM moving_averages GROUP BY moving_average ORDER BY avg_demand DESC
SELECT date, SUM(demand) AS total_demand FROM sales_data GROUP BY date HAVING total_demand > 100
SELECT * FROM demand_history WHERE demand > 500 ORDER BY date ASC
